tool.help:
.. class:: donemark
**What it does**
MiRNA duplication for expansions of miRNA family is one of the modes of their evolution. This function aims at identify miRNA duplication events by means of whole genome duplication (WGD) and others types of duplications.
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
- The sequences and coordinates of protein-coding genes - miRNA annotation file from miRNASelection or miRNATranslate
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
The duplication events of miRNAs and miRNA pairs in syntenic blocks.
Note: The different types of gene duplications contain whole genome /segmental (i.e. collinear genes in collinear blocks), tandem (consecutive repeat), proximal (in nearby chromosomal region but not adjacent), and dispersed (other modes than segmental, tandem and proximal) duplications.
